name: The Music Box Multiple Choice Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: "I wonder how I ever made it through a day, how did I settle for a world filled with shades of gray?"
questions.explanation:
Kelly Clarkson.

	The lyric is from "Before Your Love" sung by Kelly Clarkson on her 2002 compilation album for "American Idol".

questions.text: "Sometimes I wonder how I ever got along without you, you're the best part of it all, life is only as good as you make me feel."
questions.explanation:
Kelly Moneymaker.

	The lyric is from "Can't Live Without Your Love", the bonus track from Kelly Moneymaker's 2002 self-titled album. The song is also the new theme song for "Days Of Our Lives" super couple Bo and Hope Brady. Kelly's husband is Peter Reckell who plays Bo Brady.

questions.text: "Where have all the good men gone and where are all the gods, where's the streetwise Hercules to find the rise in odds?"
questions.explanation:
Bonnie Tyler.

	"Holding Out For A Hero" was originally sung by Bonnie Tyler on her 1986 album "Secret Dreams and Forbidden Fire". It was also the theme song for the 1984 television show "Cover Up". The song is also on the soundtrack for "Footloose" and "Shrek 2".

questions.text: "There you are in the early light of day, there you are in the quiet words I pray."
questions.explanation:
Martina McBride.

	"There You Are" was originally recorded on Martina McBride's 1999 album "Evolution". The song was added to her greatest hits album in 2001 and is on the soundtrack to "Where The Heart Is".

questions.text: "What are you doing tonight, I wish I could be a fly on your wall."
questions.explanation:
Clay Aiken.

	"Invisible" is from Clay Aiken's 2003 album "Measure of a Man".

questions.text: "I close my eyes, only for a moment and the moments gone."
questions.explanation:
Kansas.

	"Dust in the Wind" was performed by Kansas on their 1984 "Best of Kansas" CD. The song is also featured on the Highlander episodes, "The Darkness" and "Unholy Alliance" as Duncan remembers Tessa.

questions.text: "It ticks just like a Timex, It never lets up on you, who said life was easy, the job is never through."
questions.explanation:
Keith Urban.

	"Raining on Sunday" is from Keith Urban's second CD entitled "Golden Road". The CD came out in 2002.

questions.text: "His eyes are cold and restless, his wounds have almost healed, and she'd give half of Texas, just to change the way he feels."
questions.explanation:
Garth Brooks.

	"Rodeo" is from Garth Brooks 1991 album "Ropin' The Wind". The song also appears on his greatest hits album released in 1998.

questions.text: "Who can say for certain, maybe you're still here, I feel you all around me, your memories so clear."
questions.explanation:
Josh Groban.

	"To Where You Are" appears on Josh's self-titled 2001 album. He has performed this song on talk shows such as Rosie O'Donnell and Oprah Winfrey. He guest starred on "Ally McBeal" and sang this song. "To Where You Are" played on the soap opera "All My Children" while Anna  Hayward picked out a casket for her three month old daughter Leora Hayward in May of 2003.

questions.text: "Another day, without your smile, another day just passes by, but now I know, how much it means, for you to stay, right here with me."
questions.explanation:
Westlife.

	"I Wanna Grow Old With You" is from the Westlife album "World of Our Own" which came out in 2000.
